meanings.definition: The quality or state of being toxic.
meanings.sent1: The toxicity of the chemical was evident from the warning labels.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the toxicity of different pesticides.
meanings.sent3: The toxicity of the spoiled milk made the fridge smell terrible.
meanings.sent4: The toxicity of the relationship was slowly poisoning their happiness.
meanings.sent5: The toxicity of the venomous snake made it dangerous to approach.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance is toxic.
meanings.sent1: The high toxicity of the cleaning product required careful handling.
meanings.sent2: The toxicity of the medication was carefully monitored by the doctor.
meanings.sent3: The toxicity of the spicy chili sauce surprised his taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The toxicity of the gossip spread quickly through the office.
meanings.sent5: The toxicity of the pollution in the river was alarming to the environmentalists.

meanings.definition: The harmful effects of a toxic substance.
meanings.sent1: The toxicity of the venom caused swelling at the bite site.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters wore protective gear to shield themselves from the toxicity of the smoke.
meanings.sent3: The toxicity of the internet trolls' comments was overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The toxicity of the rumors spread like wildfire in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The toxicity of the mold in the old house made the residents sick.
